metadata.title: CVE-2018-16881 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A denial of service vulnerability was found in rsyslog in the imptcpmodule. An attacker could send a specially crafted message to the imptcpsocket, which would cause rsyslog to crash. Versions before 8.27.0 arevulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16881` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

rsyslog - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
rsyslog-czmq - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
rsyslog-elasticsearch - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
rsyslog-gnutls - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
rsyslog-gssapi - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
rsyslog-hiredis - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
rsyslog-kafka - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
rsyslog-mongodb - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
rsyslog-mysql - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
rsyslog-pgsql - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
rsyslog-relp - 8.32.0-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rsyslog package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.32.0-1ubuntu4').
